Operation 'Getindexbyname' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details, missing_context. Original summary is too generic. data.current_description: Retrieves an [index](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/guides/master-data-components#index).
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves the configuration and metadata of a specific index within a data entity. Returns the index definition including field mappings and settings. Requires appropriate License Manager permissions (View index details or Master Data administrator role).
data.reasoning: Original summary is too generic. Description lacks clarity about what is returned and the operational context. Added specificity about index configuration retrieval, return value details, and permission requirements for better AI agent understanding.

message: Operation 'Deleteindexbyname' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Original summary lacks action clarity. Description is incomplete - missing information about side effects (performance impact), response details, and permission context. Enhanced to help AI agents understand the consequences of this destructive operation.

data.current_description: Deletes an [index](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/guides/master-data-components#index).
data.description_suggestion: Permanently deletes a specified index from a data entity. This operation removes the index configuration and may impact query performance on fields previously indexed. Returns a success response on completion. Requires appropriate License Manager permissions (Remove index or Master Data administrator role).
data.reasoning: Original summary lacks action clarity. Description is incomplete - missing information about side effects (performance impact), response details, and permission context. Enhanced to help AI agents understand the consequences of this destructive operation.

message: Operation 'Validatedocumentbyclusters' has semantic quality issues: missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_context. Summary is clear and actionable. Description needs enhancement to explain what is returned, the practical use case, the five-rule limit context, and permission requirements. This helps AI agents understand when and how to use this validation operation.

data.current_description:
Checks if a document is present in one or more clusters (specific set of field values).

> There is a limit of five rules per request.
data.description_suggestion: Validates whether a document matches one or more cluster definitions (specific combinations of field values). Accepts up to five cluster rules per request. Returns validation results indicating which clusters the document belongs to. Useful for data segmentation and categorization workflows. Requires appropriate License Manager permissions (Insert or update document, Full access, or Master Data administrator role).
data.reasoning: Summary is clear and actionable. Description needs enhancement to explain what is returned, the practical use case, the five-rule limit context, and permission requirements. This helps AI agents understand when and how to use this validation operation.

message: Operation 'Listversions' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details, missing_context. Original summary is too generic. Description lacks specificity about pagination support, return value structure, and practical use. Enhanced to clarify that this returns version history with metadata and supports pagination, helping AI agents understand how to retrieve and navigate document change history.

data.current_description:
Lists the versions of a document.

> Master Data documents are versioned. This means that, for each change, a new version is generated.
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a paginated list of all versions for a specific document. Each version represents a state change in the document's history. Returns version metadata including version IDs, timestamps, and change information. Supports pagination parameters to control result size and offset. Requires appropriate License Manager permissions (Read only documents, Insert or update document, Full access, or Master Data administrator role).
data.reasoning: Original summary is too generic. Description lacks specificity about pagination support, return value structure, and practical use. Enhanced to clarify that this returns version history with metadata and supports pagination, helping AI agents understand how to retrieve and navigate document change history.

message: Operation 'Getversion' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details, missing_context. Original summary is too vague. Description lacks clarity about what is returned and practical use cases. Enhanced to explain that this returns the full document state at a specific version point, the use case for auditing/reverting, and permission requirements for better AI agent interpretability.

data.current_description:
Returns the version of a document.

> Master Data documents are versioned. This means that, for each change, a new version is generated.
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves the complete content and metadata of a specific version of a document. Returns the document state as it existed at that version, including all field values and version metadata. Useful for auditing changes or reverting to previous states. Requires appropriate License Manager permissions (Read only documents, Insert or update document, Full access, or Master Data administrator role).
data.reasoning: Original summary is too vague. Description lacks clarity about what is returned and practical use cases. Enhanced to explain that this returns the full document state at a specific version point, the use case for auditing/reverting, and permission requirements for better AI agent interpretability.

message: Operation 'Putversion' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Original summary is misleading - 'Update version' doesn't clarify the actual operation (version restoration). Description is vague about what 'updates the version value' means. Enhanced to clarify this is a restore operation, explain inputs (target version), outputs (restored document), and side effects (new version created) for clear AI agent understanding.

data.current_description: Updates the document's version value.
data.description_suggestion: Restores a document to a previous version state by updating it to match the specified version. This operation overwrites the current document content with the content from the target version. Returns the restored document with updated version metadata. Side effect: Creates a new version entry in the document's version history. Requires appropriate License Manager permissions (Insert or update document, Full access, or Master Data administrator role).
data.reasoning: Original summary is misleading - 'Update version' doesn't clarify the actual operation (version restoration). Description is vague about what 'updates the version value' means. Enhanced to clarify this is a restore operation, explain inputs (target version), outputs (restored document), and side effects (new version created) for clear AI agent understanding.

message: Operation 'Scrolldocuments' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Summary 'Scroll documents' is too generic and doesn't convey the pagination mechanism or token-based approach. Description lacks clarity on return format and rate-limiting behavior. Enhanced summary specifies the scroll token mechanism. Enhanced description clarifies the two-phase request pattern, token lifecycle, supported filter types, return behavior, and rate-limiting constraints for better AI agent understanding of when and how to use this operation.

data.current_description:
Returns a list of documents according to query parameter filters. If you need to query the entire database, or your collection is over 10000 documents, use this endpoint.

In the first request, the `X-VTEX-MD-TOKEN` token will be obtained in the response header. This token must be passed to the next request in the `_token` query string parameter. The token expires after 20 minutes of inactivity, and each request made with the token during this time resets the expiration timer.

After the token is obtained, it is no longer necessary to send the filter or document size per page parameters. You only need to resend the token until the document collection is empty.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve paginated documents using scroll token
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a paginated list of documents from a data entity using cursor-based scrolling. Ideal for querying entire databases or collections exceeding 10,000 documents. First request returns an `X-VTEX-MD-TOKEN` in the response header; subsequent requests use this token via the `_token` query parameter to fetch the next batch. The token expires after 20 minutes of inactivity but resets with each request. Supports filtering via query parameters (simple, complex, date range, numeric range, partial, null checks, and comparison operators). Returns a paginated document list; continue scrolling until the collection is empty. Rate-limited: excessive wildcard or keyword searches may trigger a 429 error.
data.reasoning: Summary 'Scroll documents' is too generic and doesn't convey the pagination mechanism or token-based approach. Description lacks clarity on return format and rate-limiting behavior. Enhanced summary specifies the scroll token mechanism. Enhanced description clarifies the two-phase request pattern, token lifecycle, supported filter types, return behavior, and rate-limiting constraints for better AI agent understanding of when and how to use this operation.

message: Operation 'Saveschemabyname' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Summary 'Save schema by name' is vague and doesn't clearly indicate create-or-update semantics. Description lacks clarity on return value and permission requirements. Enhanced summary uses action-oriented language (Create or update). Enhanced description clarifies the create-or-update behavior, schema limit constraint, trigger capability, return value, and permission requirements for better AI agent decision-making.

data.current_description:
Creates or edits a data entity schema. Learn more about [Master Data schemas](https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-rest-api/docs/master-data-schema-lifecycle). 

> Note that if you send a `schemaName` that does not exist for that data entity, this request will create it.

This request can also be used to [create or edit Master Data v2 triggers](https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-rest-api/docs/setting-up-triggers-in-master-data-v2). 

> Each Master Data v2 data entity can have up to 60 schemas.
data.summary_suggestion: Create or update data entity schema
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new schema or updates an existing schema for a data entity. If the specified `schemaName` does not exist, it will be created; otherwise, the existing schema is updated. This operation can also be used to create or edit Master Data v2 triggers. Note: Each data entity supports a maximum of 60 schemas. Returns the created or updated schema definition. Requires Master Data administrator permissions.
data.reasoning: Summary 'Save schema by name' is vague and doesn't clearly indicate create-or-update semantics. Description lacks clarity on return value and permission requirements. Enhanced summary uses action-oriented language (Create or update). Enhanced description clarifies the create-or-update behavior, schema limit constraint, trigger capability, return value, and permission requirements for better AI agent decision-making.

message: Operation 'Putindices' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Summary 'Create index' lacks context about what is being indexed (data entity). Description is too minimal and doesn't explain the purpose of indices or what is returned. Enhanced summary specifies 'for data entity' to provide context. Enhanced description clarifies the purpose (query optimization), what indices do (improve search/filtering), return value, and permission requirements for better AI agent understanding.

data.current_description: Creates an [index](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/guides/master-data-components#index).
data.description_suggestion: Creates an index on a data entity to optimize query performance. Indices improve search and filtering operations on specified fields. Returns the created index configuration. Requires appropriate License Manager permissions (Edit index, Create index, or Master Data administrator role).
data.reasoning: Summary 'Create index' lacks context about what is being indexed (data entity). Description is too minimal and doesn't explain the purpose of indices or what is returned. Enhanced summary specifies 'for data entity' to provide context. Enhanced description clarifies the purpose (query optimization), what indices do (improve search/filtering), return value, and permission requirements for better AI agent understanding.

message: Operation 'Createorupdatepartialdocument' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, unclear_purpose, poor_ai_interpretability. Original summary 'Create partial document' is ambiguous - it doesn't clarify that this can both create AND update. Description mentions 'create' in the info box but the main text only discusses updates, creating confusion. Added clarity about dual functionality (create or update), explained the partial update behavior (only provided fields change), and provided guidance on when to use this vs. the PUT endpoint. This helps AI agents distinguish between PATCH endpoints and understand the operation's true purpose.

data.current_description:
This request allows you to partially update a document corresponding to a given data entity.

> You can use this request to create documents for any given data entity. Because of this, you are not restricted to using the fields exemplified below in your requests. But you should be aware of the fields allowed or required for each document you wish to update.
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new document with an auto-generated ID or partially updates an existing document in a data entity. Only provided fields are modified; omitted fields remain unchanged. Supports flexible field schemas for any data entity. Use this endpoint when you need to create a new document without specifying an ID, or update specific fields of an existing document without replacing the entire document.
data.reasoning: Original summary 'Create partial document' is ambiguous - it doesn't clarify that this can both create AND update. Description mentions 'create' in the info box but the main text only discusses updates, creating confusion. Added clarity about dual functionality (create or update), explained the partial update behavior (only provided fields change), and provided guidance on when to use this vs. the PUT endpoint. This helps AI agents distinguish between PATCH endpoints and understand the operation's true purpose.

message: Operation 'Deletedocument' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Summary is adequate but description is extremely sparse. Original description lacks critical information: what is deleted (document by ID), the permanence of the action, what is returned (204 No Content or similar), and the irreversible nature. Added context about the destructive nature of the operation, clarified the response behavior, and emphasized the need for appropriate permissions. This helps AI agents understand the severity of this operation and when it's appropriate to use.

data.current_description: Deletes a document.
data.description_suggestion: Permanently deletes a document from a data entity by ID. This operation removes all data associated with the document and cannot be undone. Returns a success response with no content on successful deletion. Requires appropriate License Manager permissions (Full access to all documents or Master Data administrator role).
data.reasoning: Summary is adequate but description is extremely sparse. Original description lacks critical information: what is deleted (document by ID), the permanence of the action, what is returned (204 No Content or similar), and the irreversible nature. Added context about the destructive nature of the operation, clarified the response behavior, and emphasized the need for appropriate permissions. This helps AI agents understand the severity of this operation and when it's appropriate to use.

data.current_description: Creates an [index](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/guides/master-data-components#index).
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new index for a data entity to optimize query performance on specified fields. The index definition is provided in the request body and includes field names and index configuration. Returns the created index object with its metadata. This operation enables faster document retrieval and filtering on indexed fields. Requires Master Data administrator or index creation permissions.

data.current_description:
Checks if a document is present in one or more clusters (specific set of field values).

> There is a limit of five rules per request.
data.description_suggestion: Validates whether a document matches one or more cluster definitions (specific combinations of field values). Accepts up to five cluster rules per request. Returns validation results indicating which clusters the document belongs to. Useful for data segmentation and categorization workflows. Requires appropriate License Manager permissions (Insert or update document, Full access, or Master Data administrator role).
data.reasoning: Summary is clear and actionable. Description needs enhancement to explain what is returned, the practical use case, the five-rule limit context, and permission requirements. This helps AI agents understand when and how to use this validation operation.

message: Operation 'Listversions' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details, missing_context. Original summary is too generic. Description lacks specificity about pagination support, return value structure, and practical use. Enhanced to clarify that this returns version history with metadata and supports pagination, helping AI agents understand how to retrieve and navigate document change history.

data.current_description:
Lists the versions of a document.

> Master Data documents are versioned. This means that, for each change, a new version is generated.
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a paginated list of all versions for a specific document. Each version represents a state change in the document's history. Returns version metadata including version IDs, timestamps, and change information. Supports pagination parameters to control result size and offset. Requires appropriate License Manager permissions (Read only documents, Insert or update document, Full access, or Master Data administrator role).
data.reasoning: Original summary is too generic. Description lacks specificity about pagination support, return value structure, and practical use. Enhanced to clarify that this returns version history with metadata and supports pagination, helping AI agents understand how to retrieve and navigate document change history.

message: Operation 'Getversion' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details, missing_context. Original summary is too vague. Description lacks clarity about what is returned and practical use cases. Enhanced to explain that this retrieves the full document state at a specific version point, including metadata, and clarified the audit/restore use case for better AI agent interpretability.

data.current_description:
Returns the version of a document.

> Master Data documents are versioned. This means that, for each change, a new version is generated.
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves the complete content and metadata of a specific version of a document. Returns the document state as it existed at that version, including all field values and version metadata. Useful for auditing changes or restoring previous document states. Requires appropriate License Manager permissions (Read only documents, Insert or update document, Full access, or Master Data administrator role).
data.reasoning: Original summary is too vague. Description lacks clarity about what is returned and practical use cases. Enhanced to explain that this retrieves the full document state at a specific version point, including metadata, and clarified the audit/restore use case for better AI agent interpretability.

message: Operation 'Putversion' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_output_details, missing_context. Summary is acceptable but description is vague about what 'updating version value' means. Clarified that this is a restore/rollback operation that replaces current content with a previous version state, creates a new version entry, and returns the restored document. This helps AI agents understand the actual effect of this operation.

data.current_description: Updates the document's version value.
data.description_suggestion: Updates or restores a document to a specific version state. Replaces the current document content with the content from the specified version. Returns the updated document with the restored version data. This operation creates a new version entry in the document's history. Requires appropriate License Manager permissions (Insert or update document, Full access, or Master Data administrator role).
data.reasoning: Summary is acceptable but description is vague about what 'updating version value' means. Clarified that this is a restore/rollback operation that replaces current content with a previous version state, creates a new version entry, and returns the restored document. This helps AI agents understand the actual effect of this operation.

message: Operation 'Createorupdatepartialdocument' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, unclear_purpose, poor_ai_interpretability. Original summary 'Create partial document' is ambiguous - it doesn't clarify that this can both create AND update. Description mentions 'create' in the info box but the main text only discusses updates, creating confusion. Added clarity about dual functionality (create or update), explained the partial update behavior (only provided fields change), and provided guidance on when to use this vs. the PUT endpoint. This helps AI agents distinguish between PATCH endpoints and understand the operation's true purpose.

data.current_description:
This request allows you to partially update a document corresponding to a given data entity.

> You can use this request to create documents for any given data entity. Because of this, you are not restricted to using the fields exemplified below in your requests. But you should be aware of the fields allowed or required for each document you wish to update.
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new document with an auto-generated ID or partially updates an existing document in a data entity. Only provided fields are modified; omitted fields remain unchanged. Supports flexible field schemas for any data entity. Use this endpoint when you need to create a new document without specifying an ID, or update specific fields of an existing document without replacing the entire document.
data.reasoning: Original summary 'Create partial document' is ambiguous - it doesn't clarify that this can both create AND update. Description mentions 'create' in the info box but the main text only discusses updates, creating confusion. Added clarity about dual functionality (create or update), explained the partial update behavior (only provided fields change), and provided guidance on when to use this vs. the PUT endpoint. This helps AI agents distinguish between PATCH endpoints and understand the operation's true purpose.

data.current_description: Deletes a document.

Returns a success response with no content on successful deletion. Requires appropriate License Manager permissions (Full access to all documents or Master Data administrator role).
data.reasoning: Summary is adequate but description is extremely sparse. Operation 'Scrolldocuments' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Summary 'Scroll documents' is too generic and doesn't convey the pagination mechanism or token-based approach. Description lacks clarity on return format and rate-limiting behavior. Enhanced summary specifies the scroll token mechanism. Enhanced description clarifies the two-phase request pattern, token lifecycle, supported filter types, return behavior, and rate-limiting constraints for better AI agent understanding of when and how to use this operation.

data.current_description:
Returns a list of documents according to query parameter filters. If you need to query the entire database, or your collection is over 10000 documents, use this endpoint.

In the first request, the `X-VTEX-MD-TOKEN` token will be obtained in the response header. This token must be passed to the next request in the `_token` query string parameter. The token expires after 20 minutes of inactivity, and each request made with the token during this time resets the expiration timer.

After the token is obtained, it is no longer necessary to send the filter or document size per page parameters. You only need to resend the token until the document collection is empty.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve paginated documents using scroll token
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a paginated list of documents from a data entity using cursor-based scrolling. Ideal for querying entire databases or collections exceeding 10,000 documents. First request returns an `X-VTEX-MD-TOKEN` in the response header; subsequent requests use this token via the `_token` query parameter to fetch the next batch. The token expires after 20 minutes of inactivity but resets with each request. Supports filtering via query parameters (simple, complex, date range, numeric range, partial, null checks, and comparison operators). Returns a paginated document list; continue scrolling until the collection is empty. Rate-limited: excessive wildcard or keyword searches may trigger a 429 error.
data.reasoning: Summary 'Scroll documents' is too generic and doesn't convey the pagination mechanism or token-based approach. Description lacks clarity on return format and rate-limiting behavior. Enhanced summary specifies the scroll token mechanism. Enhanced description clarifies the two-phase request pattern, token lifecycle, supported filter types, return behavior, and rate-limiting constraints for better AI agent understanding of when and how to use this operation.

message: Operation 'Saveschemabyname' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Summary 'Save schema by name' is vague and doesn't clearly indicate create-or-update semantics. Description lacks clarity on return value and permission requirements. Enhanced summary uses action-oriented language (Create or update). Enhanced description clarifies the create-or-update behavior, schema limit constraint, trigger capability, return value, and permission requirements for better AI agent decision-making.

data.current_description:
Creates or edits a data entity schema. Learn more about [Master Data schemas](https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-rest-api/docs/master-data-schema-lifecycle). 

> Note that if you send a `schemaName` that does not exist for that data entity, this request will create it.

This request can also be used to [create or edit Master Data v2 triggers](https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-rest-api/docs/setting-up-triggers-in-master-data-v2). 

> Each Master Data v2 data entity can have up to 60 schemas.
data.summary_suggestion: Create or update data entity schema
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new schema or updates an existing schema for a data entity. If the specified `schemaName` does not exist, it will be created; otherwise, the existing schema is updated. This operation can also be used to create or edit Master Data v2 triggers. Note: Each data entity supports a maximum of 60 schemas. Returns the created or updated schema definition. Requires Master Data administrator permissions.
data.reasoning: Summary 'Save schema by name' is vague and doesn't clearly indicate create-or-update semantics. Description lacks clarity on return value and permission requirements. Enhanced summary uses action-oriented language (Create or update). Enhanced description clarifies the create-or-update behavior, schema limit constraint, trigger capability, return value, and permission requirements for better AI agent decision-making.
